Deprecated API

Contents

  • Deprecated Interfaces
  • Deprecated Classes
  • Deprecated Exceptions
  • Deprecated Methods
  • Deprecated Constructors
  • Deprecated Interfaces 
    Interface and Description
    org.jtrim.swing.component.ImageListener
    This interface is only used by deprecated classes. There is no replacement for this interface. The interface for the listeners which are to be notified by the AsyncImageDisplay when its underlying image changes or successfully receives the meta-data of the image.

    Thread safety

    Instances of this listener interface can only be notified from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread and therefore does not need to be thread-safe.

    Synchronization transparency

    Implementations of this interface does not need to be synchronization transparent but they must be aware that they are called from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread.
    org.jtrim.image.transform.ImageTransformer
    Use ImageTransformationStep instead. Defines an image transformation from ImageTransformerData to TransformedImage.

    When applying a transformation on the input, the conversion must specify the coordinate transformation which transforms the coordinates of the source image to the coordinates of the resulting image. That is, where a pixel of the original image can be found on the resulting image. The coordinate transformation must support coordinates laying outside the bounds of the image.

    Thread safety

    Implementations of this interface are required to be safe to be used by multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Implementations of this interface are not required to be synchronization transparent.
  • Deprecated Classes 
    Class and Description
    org.jtrim.image.transform.AffineImageTransformer
    Use AffineTransformationStep instead. Defines an ImageTransformer transforming an image based on an affine transformation.

    This AffineImageTransformer defines the offset so, that (0, 0) offset means that the center of the source image will be transformed to the center of the destination image.

    Thread safety

    Instances of this class are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this interface are not synchronization transparent and calling them while holding a lock should be avoided.
    org.jtrim.swing.component.AsyncImageDisplay
    This class is very inefficient, use TransformedImageDisplay instead. Defines a Swing component which is able to display an image applying a series of user defined transformations.

    There are three kind of properties you need to specify for this component:

    • The address of the image to be displayed. The address will be specified for the query used to retrieve the image. So the address can be any type, for example: java.net.URI. The address can be set by calling the setImageAddress method.
    • The AsyncDataQuery used to retrieve the image. The image is retrieved by the address specified previously. The query can be set by calling one of the setImageQuery methods.
    • The transformations which will be used to transform the image retrieved by the image query. These transformations can be set by calling one of the setImageTransformer methods. Note that multiple transformations can be applied to a given image in any order.

    Note that this component is an AsyncRenderingComponent and relies on an AsyncRenderer. Therefore it must be set before displaying this component, either by passing an AsyncRendererFactory to the appropriate constructor or by setting it later.

    This class is highly experimental and may see significant changes in the future.

    The thread-safety property of this component is the same as with any other Swing components. That is, instances of this class can be accessed only from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread after made displayable.
    org.jtrim.image.ImageData
    Use ImageResult instead. Defines an image which was retrieved from an external source. Apart from the image itself, the ImageData contains the meta data information of the image and an exception associated with the image retrieval.

    Although it is possible to mutate the properties of an ImageData instance, the intended use of ImageData is to use it as an effectively immutable object. That is, its properties should not be modified (e.g.: The pixels of the BufferedImage should not be modified).

    This class implements the MemoryHeavyObject interface and approximates the size of an ImageData instance by the approximate size of the underlying BufferedImage.

    Note that this class also provides several useful static helper methods, to create BufferedImage instance better handled by the Java and methods to calculate the approximate size of a BufferedImage.

    Thread safety

    Methods of this class can be safely accessed by multiple threads. Although individual properties are not immutable, they should treated so. Users of this class can assume that the properties of ImageData are not modified and can be safely accessed by multiple concurrent threads as well.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this class are synchronization transparent.
    org.jtrim.image.transform.ImageTransformerData
    This class is only used by deprecated classes. There is no replacement for this class. Defines the input of an image transformer.

    Thread safety

    Methods of this class can be safely accessed by multiple threads. Although individual properties are not immutable, they should be treated so. Users of this class can assume that the properties of ImageTransformerData are not modified and can be safely accessed by multiple concurrent threads as well.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this class are synchronization transparent.
    org.jtrim.image.transform.ImageTransformerLink
    This class is only used by deprecated classes. There is no replacement for this class. Defines an AsyncDataLink which transforms an image on the specified TaskExecutorService. There can be multiple transformations defined, each defining a more and more accurate transformation. That is, ImageTransformerLink applies each transformation to its input and forwards each transformed image assuming that the last transformation applied is the most accurate one.

    Note that essentially each transformation defines the same transformation, they should only differ in the accuracy of their result.

    This class works similar to the AsyncDataLink instances created by the AsyncLinks.convertGradually method. The only difference is that ImageTransformerLink will convert the result of the transformation (TransformedImage) to TransformedImageData.

    Thread safety

    The methods of this class are safe to be accessed by multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.
    org.jtrim.image.transform.ImageTransformerQuery
    This class is only used by deprecated classes. There is no replacement for this class. Defines an AsyncDataQuery which transforms its input image on the specified TaskExecutorService. There can be multiple transformations defined, each defining a more and more accurate transformation. That is, ImageTransformerLink applies each transformation to its input and forwards each transformed image assuming that the last transformation applied is the most accurate one.

    Note that essentially each transformation defines the same transformation, they should only differ in the accuracy of their result.

    This class is effectively a factory for ImageTransformerLink instances. That is, the createDataLink method creates an ImageTransformerLink with the arguments specified at construction time.

    Thread safety

    The methods of this class are safe to be accessed by multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.
    org.jtrim.swing.component.SimpleAsyncImageDisplay
    This class is very inefficient, use BasicTransformedImageDisplay instead. Defines a Swing component which is able to display an image, applying a series of user defined transformations and convenience methods to apply basic image transformations. This component supports every transformation of the BasicTransformationModel. These basic transformations are applied on transformation index: 0. Other transformations might be applied before and after these transformations by calling any of the setImageTransformer method with the appropriate transformation index.

    Additionally this component is able to display the image using various interpolations and even using multiple interpolations at once. If multiple interpolations are used, they will be used to render the image in the requested order. This can be beneficial when using a fast interpolation first and a slow but better interpolation last. With this settings when rapidly changing the transformation properties of this component, the fast interpolation will be displayed to the user while it calculates the better interpolated image.

    This component defines the offset of the image so that if it is (0.0, 0.0), the center of the image will be in the center of the component.

    Note: You should set the TaskExecutorService used to render the image by calling setDefaultExecutor. You may also use different TaskExecutorService instances for different interpolation types by calling the setExecutor method. Using distinct executors for different interpolation type is advantageous in most cases because it prevents slow interpolations from blocking fast interpolations.

    About other properties of this component see the description of AsyncImageDisplay.

    The thread-safety property of this component is the same as with any other Swing components. That is, instances of this class can be accessed only from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread after made displayable.
    org.jtrim.image.async.SimpleUriImageLink
    Use InputStreamImageLink instead or create a data link via UriImageIOQuery. Defines an AsyncDataLink which is able to retrieve an image based on an URI. To actually retrieve the image file from the external source, the URL class is used, therefore SimpleUriImageLink is able to retrieve any image which the URL class can. To load the image, the ImageIO library of Java is used and therefore the meta data of the retrieved image is a JavaIIOMetaData.

    The SimpleUriImageLink is able to retrieve partially retrieved image and even the meta data without the image until the complete image is available.

    Thread safety

    The methods of this class are safe to be accessed by multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.
    org.jtrim.image.async.SimpleUriImageQuery
    Use UriImageIOQuery instead. Defines an AsyncDataQuery which is able to retrieve images based on an URI. The URI is specified as an input for the query. To actually retrieve the image file from the external source, the URL class is used, therefore SimpleUriImageLink is able to retrieve any image which the URL class can. To load the image, the ImageIO library of Java is used and therefore the meta data of the retrieved image is a JavaIIOMetaData.

    This implementation completely relies on the SimpleUriImageLink to retrieve images.

    Thread safety

    The methods of this class are safe to be accessed by multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.
    org.jtrim.image.transform.TransformedImageData
    This class is only used by deprecated classes. There is no replacement for this class. Defines the output of an ImageTransformerLink.

    Thread safety

    Methods of this class can be safely accessed by multiple threads. Although individual properties are not immutable, they should be treated so. Users of this class can assume that the properties of ImageTransformerData are not modified and can be safely accessed by multiple concurrent threads as well.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this class are synchronization transparent.
    org.jtrim.image.transform.ZoomToFitTransformer
    Use ZoomToFitTransformationStep instead. Defines an ImageTransformer scaling an image to fit the display.

    Special cases:

    • If neither FIT_WIDTH, nor FIT_HEIGHT is specified, then the image is not scaled (i.e., the applied zoom property is 1.0).
    • If exactly one of FIT_WIDTH and FIT_HEIGHT is specified, then the aspect ratio is honored unless the absence of MAY_MAGNIFY requires that the applied zoomX or zoomY must not exceed 1.0.
    • If MAY_MAGNIFY is not specified, then neither the applied zoomX, nor the zoomY can be greater than 1.0. They will be reduced accordingly (if KEEP_ASPECT_RATIO is not set, then only the offending one will be reduced to 1.0).

    Thread safety

    Instances of this class are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this interface are not synchronization transparent and calling them while holding a lock should be avoided.
  • Deprecated Exceptions 
    Exceptions and Description
    org.jtrim.image.ImageReceiveException
    This exception is needed only for ImageData which is deprecated. Defines the cause of a failure of an image retrieval attempt.
  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    org.jtrim.concurrent.TaskExecutors.upgradeExecutor(TaskExecutor)
    The behaviour of this method is somewhat surprising. You should rather use the upgradeToStoppable or the upgradeToUnstoppable method. Returns a TaskExecutorService which upgrades the specified TaskExecutor to provide all the features of a TaskExecutorService except that it is may or may not possible to shutdown the returned executor. Tasks submitted to the returned TaskExecutorService will be forwarded to the execute method of the specified TaskExecutor.

    Shutting down the returned executor has no effect on the specified TaskExecutor, even if already implemented the TaskExecutorService interface.
  • Deprecated Constructors 
    Constructor and Description
    org.jtrim.image.transform.SerialImagePointTransformer(ImagePointTransformer...)
    Use the factory method SerialImagePointTransformer.combine instead.

    Creates a new SerialImagePointTransformer from an array of coordinate transformations.
    org.jtrim.image.transform.SerialImagePointTransformer(List)
    Use the factory method SerialImagePointTransformer.combine instead.

    Creates a new SerialImagePointTransformer from a list of coordinate transformations.
